comments.body: Yes plz
it is actually called an aquamarine but I love the idea
I do think the Ocean Monuments need some better loot (gold blocks are useless at that part of the game), but Tridents have durability, and they aren't too powerful a weapon!
Also, warped and crimson variations.

This could just as easily be applied to barrels!  And they could be just as diverse as doors.  You wouldn't even need to change the classic texture if you want, just craft again with a plank of the relevant color and you can keep the old texture while adding a bunch of new ones.

I particularly like the idea of one of the nether mushroom woods having gold accents, to fit in with piglin's love of gold.
Honestly, yeah. It's so weird that it's not a thing yet considering there's so many items, you need a ton of chests. I would love to be able to be able to organize them without signs.

This little addition would make the paintings more usefull, i have just build a huge odd build, and realized that there are no 3x3 paintings to go with it. Which made me question my existance for not knowing it. It would also bring more options for Texture Packs.

This is really needed. Almost every house I make has a nice 3x3 spot above a door or fireplace, etc and there is no way to hang a painting that looks good. If I force the 1x2 painting in center the wall always looks like the painting is too small
Too vague to be even considered

This would be a cool idea, but they have already specifically stated that mining helmets are too modern to be added to the game. However, it is possible that some sort of glow ink from the glow squid could be used in this way. So don't lose all hope!
Yea cool idea you could make the helmet have a light on it
Helmet would be cool if it had a narrow / spot beam. Light level 10-13.
Please get a mining helmet
Please mining helmet with torch
make it a torch strapped to a helmet so it isn't modern
The normal texture of it currently needs some work, I might add
I think copper is very underwhelming right now. We have plenty of light blue blocks, especially with the warped fungis. It looks pretty good as an orange building block though.
They also should allow us to fix the process on a certain stage, so its possible to have the orangy copper with blue speckles if we want, or a near full blue block with orange speckles
Wow, thats a good idea!

My idea on this was to have the glow squid drop something like "glow ink" which could be used to brew potions of polishing. These would then be made into splash potions and could be thrown on copper blocks (making it into polished copper), which cleans them if they are already rusted and make it so they won't deteriorate.

Yeah i hate it. If i wanted a green/blue roof, I’d use the prismarine blocks not copper. The decision to make copper oxidise naturally also goes against Jeb’s game design book where he states that ‘bad things happen, but they’re technically the players fault’. I’d consider copper oxidising a ‘bad thing’ and its not the player who causes the copper to oxidise, it’s a game mechanic, thus violating this ‘rule for minecraft’. Copper oxidising should be the players decision not the games decision, and i believe copper should exist in a form that can get oxidised and a form that cannot.
Wonderful idea! Then the player would still have to use blocks or water to truly save themselves.
Levitation for 30 seconds. If that doesnt get you high enough you will have 30 seconds to think about what you've done
This is a very good idea but..... when are you in that situation
Scar from Hermitcraft has proposed this idea, so you know how helpful this is for building! We need this!
I found out that in 1.16.2 pre-release 1 that now chains can be placed sideways! Now, they still didn't add the ability to connect both vertical and horizontal chains, hope they do it soon.
Yes! I came looking for this idea just to upvote it! Chains should act like glass panes a bit :D
Yo
Hi
Well they added renewable gravel in 1.16.....
Fixed header (all caps are not required nor needed here for those).

Well, I can improve your idea. With the 1.14, we now have more block ideas. For that reason, i'm presenting this suggestion:

Add the Chiseler Station, a new Block that let us to make more chiseled versions of every stone and stone-like block.

a) Why add it?:

Adding it would increase the posibilities of building. Chisled things always have been pretty good and beautiful, and adding more variations could make better Houses, Castles, Cities, Villages, and even more.

b) How we would craft it?:

With the newest 1.16, we have new Blocks, and the Crafting Recipe of this block would consist of the next elements: 4 Chiseled Stone Bricks, 1 Redstone Dust, 3 Iron Ingots and 1 Netherite Scrap.



c) How look the block?:

Well, I don't have idea of how it should look. But There is an old texture wich can be used for this block. Even it fit the essence of Chiseling:


d) How would look its GUI/UI (User Interface)?:

Well, for this I've taken inspiration of the stonecutter GUI and Improved it to look good. Also, the saw should be animated.




Thanks, I hope that this would be a great idea for improving this.

(excess graphics removed - please don't add animations, thanks! ~ admin)
I will love minecraft if they add the chisel
Maybe make sculptures too?
This is what the game needs. This is what the miners and crafters need. We all need it.
Minecraft should add fairy lights and a Chisel

There should be a selection of chiseled patterns to choose from based off different architectural styles and player suggested patterns. These could be made similar to banner patterns and combined in the stone cutter to make them.

Does nobody do research anymore?! This idea has been posted before. Please take your post down, find the other post, vote for it, and comment if you have something new to add to the conversation.

Thanks
How about maximum 2 so if there is a smeltable that can be smelted twice like cobblestone it will be turned into its second state.
How do you change your in game gamer tag?
Also make them so it cant be combined with the fortune enchantment
Exactly! I have a problem where I had to remove these blocks from my base because my newly built automatic Carrot/Potato farms wouldn't work because of them.

I agree 100%. Maybe adding something as simple as left clicking the villager workstation with a stick or something simple. As of now you can only use iron doors to prevent villagers from going into your build but it doesn’t stop them from standing outside of it. It gets even more annoying when you have multiple villagers outside of your build.
Villegers not linking to renamed workstations would be a proper solution

Yeah, it gets kind of annoying building a base anywhere near a village and then having a bunch of Villagers claim my workstations. I think if they ever do this, they should also do it for beds some way, as they claim those constantly, too.

I really need this in the game. I like to make a base in a village, but this makes it very difficult to play the game the way i want to. This feature would solve a lot for me. If someone knows about a mod that does this, please let me know. I couldn't find any.
Iron is kind of the generic metal that can be used for everything already

I think silver is necessary, but I think it will be a white-colored silver ore so as not to be confused with iron.
Ingot also distinguishes it from iron, so it has a color similar to white.
Unlike copper, silver cannot make equipment, tools, or swords, and is used for construction, but it is used for making mirrors and making accessories using silver called "silver accessories" (for dealing with villagers). (Used), and can be used to make amulets, etc.
So, given these things, I think silver should be in Minecraft.
With silver, you can make gold medals, silver medals, and bronze medals.
a me gustaria qe si huviera  armadura y armas porque siendo plata y que el juego se basa en la epoca medieval que este mineral haga un daño considerable a los monstruos

I know it makes sense, but you should present some ideas for what it would do. Copper already does basically nothing, so we don't really need another ore with no good uses. If blocks of silver were reflective, that would be super cool. We need mirrors.
we need silver
Hi
Silver ore becomes a silver ingot when smelted and can probably be used as currency along with Emeralds.
I think silver should also be used to make silver tipped arrows that deal more damage to undead mobs, since the undead are known to be weak against silver
U reelee need more info abowt silver
Okay here is an idea silver could be used to craft elytra but it would have to be an end ore.

i think silver should spawn unique to other ores maybe you could get it by brushing a sand or even a opposite gravity block as in https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/34023278832525-Upside-down-Water-and-Sand

you might brew silver to make a quick silver potion(e.g. attack speed potion).

as in https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360057862471-Stamina-Potions-Increase-Attack-Speed
A tool and a book in the grindstone. But instead of receiving xp you loose XP. If you don't have enough xp some enchantments get lost
Just what I was going to say, this is a feature that would be awesome to have added in a future update!

I think they should add something like "magic anvil" (Magic anvil have the same crafting recipe as the anvil, but there is enchanting table instead of the middle iron ingot. The magic anvil's durrability is 2 times better then the anvil's durrability.) that have three slots- 1. slot is for item that have the enchant you want elsewhere: 2. slot is for the item where you want the enchant; 3. slot is item from 2. slot + the enchants from 1. slot item (the 1. slot item was destroyed). The procedure costs experience points for every extracted enchant.

I do not like this idea because you can take ANY enchantment from ANY piece of equipment and put it on ANY other equipment you desire. I think that's too OP. Even with the addition of requiring levels (which practically mean nothing when you have a good XP farm) it is still way to crazy.

It is possible to obtain enchantments on items without an enchantment table, and this would completely outclass the enchantment table. Using this 'magic anvil' along with the regular anvil completely ruins the use of the enchantment table and the game progression. 

Finally, I dont think you are supposed to be all picky-choosy with what enchantments you want. This would reduce several hour OP enchantment grinds severely, possibly making them only minutes long.  

TLDR Sorry. I don't like this idea. Too OP. Not very fitting within the current state of the game

There should be enchanting equipments to:

  • Extract all enchantments from an item into a book, destroying the item in the process (Drawback: The item is destroyed).
  • Extract one random enchantment from an item into a book (Drawback: It's random).
This can be a fun way to mess with your friends and leave them stranded inside the nether.
This will also make sure people don't use one side of the portal for free obsidian.
Only if there is one portal linked to one portal but yes, it would be great !
This would sadly break most obsidian farms

Why would you do that though? Diamond gear doesn't naturally generate in most places, so you won't just have a bunch of diamond gear lying around (unless you raid end cities a lot) and you can disenchant the diamond gear in case you get an enchant that you don't like. Diamond gear is also the best gear, so you won't grow out of it and have no use of it, which makes no sense for the fact you would like to break the gear down.
neat idea, but why

This becomes OP when you begin breaking down the diamond tools and armor that can be bought from villagers. Many multiplayer economies use diamonds as currency, so a diamond's value goes beyond the tools it can make; when these become renewable and even easily farmable, their value is lost.

The reason why would be obvious i think. get a villager who is an armorsmith. turn him into a zombie then cure him so you get sick deals. i currently have 1 that sells me an enchanted diamond boots and pants for 1 emerald each. if you could break down the gear that would make turning emeralds into raw diamonds possible. also the comment above about being OP is kind of off. by the time this becomes possible to do efficiently you have already beaten the nether to the point of having blaze rods to cure villagers. and if you're willing to break down enchanted diamond gear to get diamonds I wouldn't say your at an early stage game when this is OP. however if it where possible i would assume they would ad something like iron and gold nuggets where you would need to do it nine times per piece of gear to get 1 diamond. 9 emeralds per diamond doesn't seem crazy OP. or if you do it without curing a villager that's 144 emeralds per diamond (pre villager curing for my guy is 16 emeralds per boots so 16x9) for early game people with no nether rod access.

If people are wondering why this would be a good idea, think about all of the armor you get from the end. All of the armor that you don't need to wear, enchant, or use for some other reason, is completely useless. If they were to add a new "break-down" method. then you would be able to turn all of that unused armor into diamonds or iron! I think that this would be a really cool add to minecraft and it would definitely get rid of the grind that you would have to do to find diamonds and iron other ways.

TL;DR unwanted armor from the end could be turned into diamonds or iron.

to those whom call it 'op', consider this, the ability to buy everything diamonds make is already a feature, and diamonds in thier current state are already too common, with the ability to find them in so many more ways than just mining, so either mojang can embrace the ease in getting diamonds, or they can completely nerf the ease, and make it harder. (i would personally prefer a nerf, ((maybe in the form of making villager leveling slower)))

In the past this may have been foolish but with 1.20 with the changes for Netherite Smithing templates and armor trims this has a lot of value add now. Getting a template duplicated costs 6 diamonds now. After raiding a few end cities I have an entire barrel of diamond armors and tools I cannot use. I grind stoned off the exp but that is about all I can do with it now.
Add a un crafting table

Enchant Timber, 3 levels:
1. Only a tree is cut down.
2. Cut down a tree with leaves.
3. Items immediately go to your inventory.
One block of a tree is one ax strength point.
Works only on grown trees, not on erected blocks.
It could take extra time to break the bottom block, but different levels of the enchantment could speed it up.
If we're keeping to the naming convention for Minecraft enchantments, I think a better name would be "Felling."

This would be great for late game, I know lots of grindy players don't want timber and that's why if this enchantment came to the game I'd say we make it hard to obtain like silk touch and infinity.   make it so some enchantments can't be added together on the axe so you'll need two axes kinda like how we all got a silk touch pic.  that way it's kinda a harder item to gain. 

It can function basically just like the timber mod, once this is on your axe you can chop down a tree all in one go as long as you chop at the base, bonus points if it gives you a few saplings and the leaves from the tree as well instead of just the wood.  Just like how durability is handled in the timber mod, the amount of wood blocks in the whole tree also takes the same amount of durability from the axe just as if you chopped it down like regular.

I play Minecraft from first version, i play so much, but one things don't change: i hate chop the tree.
Now i dream a enchantment like treecapitator, if you cut the log base, all tree drop what it drop if i chop manually. Please please please

This should be a thing. Call the enchantment "Felling".

More tool specific enchantments in general would be nice to see, all we have are efficiency, fortune, and silk touch. Yet there's luck of the sea and lure for fishing poles.
I think how it should work is it should destroy a 1x1 log and any log blocks that are above it, but not next to it, and also drain 1.5x or 2x the durability for each log block destroyed
That's still very op.

To keep this from being to being op there should be some downside and limitations to using the potion. Some ideas:

  • Fairly rare brewing ingredient that is hard to get in large quantities and can't be farmed AFK effectively, though not so rare that the potion would never be used. Something like Eye of Ender in rarity.
  • Short duration, say 20 seconds for basic and 1 minute for enhanced.
  • While potion is active all non-xray'd blocks will appear like glass. This will make movement much more difficult and somewhat risky as terrain / falls will be hard to see.
  • Held items, especially maps, would be invisible.
  • Effect negated by obsidian - this block would still appear transparent, but no "shown" blocks other than bedrock would be visible behind obsidian.
  • Should only show mobs, perhaps other "living" features such as plants, moving water, lava, and bedrock. Should not show chests or spawners as that would make finding dungeons far too easy.
I like xray
Can you give more detail on how to cure curses using trades with a Cleric as I have tried so much and nothing has worked...
402080842971 I think he was suggesting that as something they should add to the game, not that it exists. He starts by saying there IS NO way to remove a curse currently.
You should have to give up something valuable to remove a curse since otherwise it'll be too easy. Maybe like a portion of its max durability and 20 levels.

Another way to do this, that I think could be cool. Is if they made an item that could cure the curses, but make it so that something rare is needed like an enchanted golden apple. It could for example be an enchanted golden apple and a potion of weakness. Which also would fit with the lore that golden apples and potions of weakness can cure curses, like how you cure a Zombie villager.
Yes! I miss easy Jack-o-lanters.
As a builder that uses large quantities of jack o'lanterns for lighting. This would be great in an automatic pumpkin farm.
+1 TIL about it, and it looks really strange to me that it is impossible now :( Need to make lots of jack-o-lanters, and such a bummer :/
Agree completely, this would be clutch for Jack-o-lantern farming
please allow us to do this, this would make crafting jack'o lanterns much quicker

I think that by either allowing the pumkin to be sheared automatically or by allowing the pumpkin to be dispensed as a full block by the dispenser, would be an asset and a great benefit to the  game as a whole, whilst enhancing the application of the jack o lantern, which I believe to be a very under appreciated lighting block.

In each of my worlds I have used thousands if not tens of, possibly hundreds of thousands of jack o lantern blocks as in floor lighting/ceiling lighting.
Yes Please!!!
I do love brownies XD
I wish I could try them but I'm allergic. I bet they taste good.
BROWNIES!!!!!!! WOOOOO
This actually doesn't seem as illogical as something like pizza in Minecraft. Voted!
Brownies do sound good! Maybe they could be for 2 food points.
Great idea!
I'm only voting for this because ibxtoycat said he would eat 15 bananas in a row if there are bananas in 1.15.

@TravelByTrain

That’s as good enough reason as any!
Banana Peel - Master of Comedy, Minecraft Edition.
i like this idea i think this should be added to minecraft great thinking

We had squid for so log but we don't have food for it

also it is such an easy way for players to get a food source.
This is a great idea considering squids are basically an ambient mob like bats, except they drop ink sacs. It'd be nice for squids to get some recognition and purpose beyond this arguably niche use.
Yep, and I think it must take longer time to chew it because you know, that's how it works.
Maybe with the new glow squids there would be a glowing calamari for when you eat it, it gives you the glowing effect.
Maybe should be called a quarter slab?
Maybe, but "slab" actually means a "plane" or planar structure. This looks more like solid blocks, but smaller, with 1/8 of their volume
I've always wanted something like this. Maybe all the blocks in the game could be broken as they are now or smaller 1/8 blocks could be broken or placed while crouching.
Well since vertical slabs would automatically interfere with using horizontal ones, why not octablocks...
or a chunk? ( the name is still good though)
